name: Probability Distribution
description:
Let $X$ be a $\mathbb{R}^d$ Random variable defined on $(\Omega, \mathbb{P})$. The collection of numbers $\mathbb{P}(\{\omega\in\Omega : X(\omega)\in A\})$ for all $A\subseteq\mathbb{R}^d$ is called the distribution of $X$ according to $\mathbb{P}$.

The probability distribution of random variable (in broad terms) tells us how likely a random variable is to take on certain values. For instance, a coin flip has a 50-50 chance to show heads or tails.
